meanings.definition: To stay awake longer than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was outwatching her friend during the sleepover.
meanings.sent2: The owl is outwatching the other birds in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was outwatching the mouse, but the mouse was wide awake too!
meanings.sent4: The stars seem to be outwatching the moon tonight.
meanings.sent5: Outwatching the sunrise is a peaceful way to start the day.

meanings.definition: To keep watch or vigil for an extended period of time.
meanings.sent1: The security guard was outwatching the building all night.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse keeper is outwatching the sea for any signs of danger.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outwatching the nuts in the tree, making sure no one took them.
meanings.sent4: The old tree outwatches over the entire forest, protecting its inhabitants.
meanings.sent5: Outwatching the storm, the sailor guided the ship safely to shore.
